messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Help...sick!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/17/2003 8:58:40 AM Pacific Standard Time, ... Oooooh, good ideas!  It s at times like these when I wish I had nearby family who
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/17/2003 8:58:40 AM Pacific Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

> Are you near enough for someone here to go and take care of you and for
> their
> kids to hang out with yours? Is there someone who could take your kids
> away
> for a while? Is there a teenager you know who could come and stay with
> them
> at night? A homeschooled teen who could stay with you until your husband
> gets back?
>

Oooooh, good ideas! It's at times like these when I wish I had nearby family
who wasn't...how shall I put this kindly...completely insane.

Thanks
Carol, quietly dying


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Help...sick!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/17/03 8:24:13 AM, sognokids@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/17/03 8:24:13 AM, sognokids@... writes:

<< Does anyone have any miracle remedies for me? I'd be
interested in *anything* that would put me back on my feet.
>>

Are you near enough for someone here to go and take care of you and for their
kids to hang out with yours? Is there someone who could take your kids away
for a while? Is there a teenager you know who could come and stay with them
at night? A homeschooled teen who could stay with you until your husband
gets back?

I take Nyquill without guilt or fear when I think I'm going to die but I have
to take care of kids. But having another human and sleeping off your flu
would be better.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Help...sick!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/17/03 10:23:50 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Not a miracle and not homeopathic but I just got over the same thing.  Mine turned out to be
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/17/03 10:23:50 AM Eastern Standard Time,
sognokids@... writes:

> Does anyone have any miracle remedies for me? I'd be
> interested in *anything* that would put me back on my feet.
>
>

Not a miracle and not homeopathic but I just got over the same thing. Mine
turned out to be strep infection and I took my antibiotics and was feeling
much better in about 24 hours and felt 100% better in 2 days.
Pam G.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Help...sick!
messages.msgSnippet: I think I have the flu.  My body aches so violently, it hurts to wear clothes.  I have a severe sore throat and absolutely no voice (a symptom several people
messages.messageBody:
I think I have the flu. My body aches so violently, it hurts to wear
clothes. I have a severe sore throat and absolutely no voice (a symptom
several people in my family are enjoying!). My dilemma is this: my
mother-in-law is expected to live perhaps another 12-24 hours, at which point
my husband will fly across the country for the funeral. I will be here with
three delightfully spirited children who are a challenge even when I am
feeling well. Does anyone have any miracle remedies for me? I'd be
interested in *anything* that would put me back on my feet.

Thanks,
Carol, covered from head to toe in Darn This Cold aromatherapy rub


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
